meanings.definition: To sit on eggs in order to keep them warm and allow them to hatch.
meanings.sent1: The mother bird will incubate her eggs until they hatch.
meanings.sent2: The hen will incubate her eggs for about three weeks.
meanings.sent3: Why did the penguin decide to incubate the fish instead of the eggs?
meanings.sent4: Her ideas began to incubate in her mind, waiting to hatch into a brilliant plan.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the sun helped the eggs to incubate and bring new life into the world.

meanings.sent1: Patience is key when you want an idea to incubate and grow.
meanings.sent2: The plan needs time to incubate before it can be successful.
meanings.sent3: The friendship between the two children started to incubate during the summer break.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for art began to incubate in her heart, becoming stronger with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The seed was left to incubate in the soil, waiting for the right conditions to sprout.

meanings.definition: To maintain a controlled environment for the growth of microorganisms.
meanings.sent1: Scientists incubate bacteria in the lab to study their growth.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician will incubate the samples at a specific temperature.
meanings.sent3: The microbes decided to incubate a dance party in the petri dish.
meanings.sent4: The warm and humid conditions in the greenhouse helped the plants to incubate and thrive.
meanings.sent5: The incubator was used to carefully incubate the cultures for the experiment.
